news.title: Antarctica is practically defined by ice: What happens when it melts?
news.summary: Home Earth Earth Sciences October 13, 2016 October 13, 2016 A single season of intense melting buffeted Antarctica in 2001-2002.

news.title: Antarctica is practically defined by ice. What happens when it melts?
news.summary: A single season of intense melting buffeted Antarctica in 2001-2002. It yielded changes that ranged from speeding up microbial food webs to shifting penguin populations.

news.title: Season of intense melting in Antarctica offers insights into continent's future - Technology Org
news.summary: A single season of intense melting that affected Antarctica between 2001 and 2002 offers new insights into the southernmost continent’s ecological future and the potential impact of climate change worldwide, according to observations collected in a…

blogs.title: What Happens to Ecosystems When Antarctica’s Ice Melts?
blogs.summary: A special section in the October issue of BioScience featuring research by Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory scientists examines the effects of intense melting on two Antarctic ecosystems, tracking impacts all the way from microbial food webs to shifting pe

author.name: State of the Planet
author.description: Tapping experts in climate, geology, oceanography, ecology, sustainable development, global health, energy, food and water, State of the Planet captures stories of how the Earth works and how we can sustainably make our lives better.
